welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Have you ever filled out a form online? What parts do you remember—was it a login form, a comment box, or a dropdown menu? What made it easy or hard to use?”

aim.data: State the agenda and objective: Learn how to create and use <form>, <input>, <label>, <textarea>, <button>, and <select> in a webpage.

review.data: Connect to last class’s topic on <table> layout. Discuss how data is read versus how it is entered.

relevant.data: Mini-lecture and live demo in WebStorm covering the structure of a form, proper nesting, attribute use, and accessibility.

interactive.data: Students build a complete Contact Us form using a variety of form tags. Include label, input types, textarea, select, and buttons.

ownership.data: Students customize their forms (text, order, styling), and push them to their GitHub Pages site.

resonate.data: Exit reflection: 'What part of building forms felt easy? What confused you?' Share with peers and instructor.

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, internet, GitHub access, optional printed form tag references.
